turns.speaker: TIMMY
turns.text: You're crazy.  She's Ed's girl friend.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Doesn't hurt to ask.  Sometimes the most beautiful girls are the loneliest.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: None at all.  I wonder what the Brebner twins are doing tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: That's what I want -- a gaff rig.

turns.speaker: TIMMY
turns.text: Gaff rigged?  Why not a staysail schooner?  Go anywhere.  Look at this -- the Mayan, an Alden schooner.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Anyone know what time it is?

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: They tend to follow moving things. Maybe it's following Polo and Timmy.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: By 7:46, when the tide turns around, we'll be twenty miles out.  More, with this wind.

turns.speaker: DOUG
turns.text: Sideways -  For every yard we go this way, we also slide sideways this way....

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Take a break for a minute, okay?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Eddie, can we do that?  Can we go skiing?  We can use my Uncle's boat.  Eddie?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: With you, everything's next week. I want to go skiing soon.  Tomorrow?

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: You want to tack, or just leave her pointed up like this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The tide's running.  It'll take us to the light.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: It'll take us to Budapest if you're not careful.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: They'll be there when we get there. Might even have a fire started.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: What're we going to do in the mean time?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I dunno.  We'll think of something.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Promise me something.

turns.speaker: TINA
turns.text: That you'll put down a blanket.  I've got black and blue marks all over my butt, and my Mom's getting uptight about them.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Right after, the Kids went out?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: All of them.  Mike, Junior Vaughn, Brookie Peters, Pat, Lucy -- all that whole gang.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Yep.  Looked like they were headed to the lighthouse.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Mrs. Brody, look -- if he can't go, then you can't go.  Neither of you can go.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: What the hell, they can't fire both of us -- someone's got to be in charge, right?  Which way are we going?

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Rich or poor, it's nice to have money.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Happens every season -- someone takes off.  Once we had a schooner for a month while the owners went fox hunting.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: I don't care about the overtime, I'm hungry.  And cold.  And most of all, bored.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: It comes here from Cable Junction.

turns.speaker: HENDRICKS
turns.text: Untangle it and let's go -- We don't need a blackout on the island.

turns.speaker: RED
turns.text: Now you're talking.  Let's get out of here before we do find something.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's an island, near here, with a lighthouse.  We sometimes hang out there, you know....

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Too hot tor those two?  I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Is there something I don't know about?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We'll be over by the lighthouse.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll be right there.  Wait up.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'd like to go out to the light- house with you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Maybe you and Brooke could come over to the town beach....

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No way.  Everybody's going sailing. If you don't want to take me, just say so.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's not it.  My dad told me not to go.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You do everything your parents tell you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Good.  I'll be on the dock at eight.  Eight o'clock, everybody!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can go out if I want to.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's fun!  Let's race for some- thing!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: We're fighting wind and current. I though we'd be out longer, catch the incoming tide.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Mike and Larry are racing! Loser goes home alone!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: If we beat them, they can both go home stag!  Single-O!  Alone! Jackie can come back in this boat!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Uh.  Well.  Maybe you could give Polo a hand going in....

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Your ass I will.  Besides, the wind's turning with the tide. Sailing back is going to be a bitch.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: He's got to help or it won't work.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I don't think she's such hot stuff.

turns.speaker: POLO
turns.text: When are we going out?  You and me?

turns.speaker: POLO
turns.text: Anyone want to go the lighthouse?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't need you.  Andy's here.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: Do I have to play with the little kids?

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: You eat Cheerios.  I want Fruit Loops.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I want to go with you!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Look -- if you're going to get in the way, you can just go home.

turns.speaker: SEAN
turns.text: I'm not in the way.  Andy, am I in the way?

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: And if you have any questions about recreational possibilities, Ellen Brody here will be happy to answer them.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Len, can I see you a minute?

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: I think we got a couple of live ones.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: How the hell do we get him down. from there?

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Maybe nobody will notice.  Let's get them back in the bus.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: What the hell is he doing?

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: You should've been out there.  You should've seen him waving that gun, like a maniac.  There were shots fired!

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: He thought he had a good reason.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: Larry, I'm a businessman, trying to make a buck like anybody else.

turns.speaker: PETERSON
turns.text: So it can't be done like that.  The man's a menace, plain and simple.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Look, what am I supposed to do? It's done, it's over.  We have to deal with the consequences.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I have to walk him till the drug wears off.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Why don't you take a rest, Brian?

turns.speaker: BRIAN
turns.text: I'm only walking him.  You caught him.  You have to be exhausted.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Get the hose!  We've got to force more water through the gills and oxygenate him!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Okay... Have them get it out of the tank.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No one's ever caught a Great White except indirectly in fishing nets. I want to dart it and keep it alive.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: It would make a marvelous attraction;  the only Great White in captivity.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No, it will be too much distraction.  I don't want that many people in the water.  I'll go in, give it a belly shot, and get out.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: And Philip will be there to film it.  Now that's the end of it!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't understand.  Overman's too good a diver to disappear.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Have you checked the bars?  The guy's irresponsible;  he's done this before.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll need more men to look.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: Can't help you, Mike.  Don't have the manpower.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: We're going to have to cover the entire lagoon.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: I know, but you're just going to have to find another way.  So you better start.

turns.speaker: CALVIN
turns.text: What you're saying is we have a Great White shark in the lagoon.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's easy.  Put a net on the derrick.  Put the net in the water by the intake passage. Turn off the intake passage. Shark comes out into the net and is hauled up.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Well, don't worry about your fiancee.  We'll watch over her.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She can take care of herself. She doesn't need you.

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Never know down there.  Helps to have a friend, sometimes.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How many sharks have you killed?

turns.speaker: IKE
turns.text: Me?  I don't know.  Twenty, thirty.  I love them, think they're the greatest.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Well, not much longer to go.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Till this opens, not our wedding.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hope I make it through both.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You will.  I'll see to it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Damn it.  I can't understand!  I gotta go, hon.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Don't forget you have your brother.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't let him get you.  Just continue your patterns and pretend he's not around.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Everything's going wrong.  I'm having more trouble with Bobby than I ever have before.  I can't get him to respond.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I don't know.  I can't understand it.  Something's bothering them.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: And what else is bothering you?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: ... Hutton.  He really pisses me off.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, you really don't like him.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I don't like what he does.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: He doesn't need the money.  He inherited a fortune.  He kills for kicks.  TV battles between non-predator fish and divers. The diver always wins.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Okay, forget him now.  I'm going to pick up Sean.  Take a ride?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I can't leave now.  We taking Sean out?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Sure.  Want to try that new Italian place?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: No, you don't need all that starch.  You're getting too fat.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: We play hide and seek all the time.  They find a lot of things.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Look, Michael... you don't have to come.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Take a deep breath and hold it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Baby goddamn scared me to death!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: They just wanted to say hello.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let's head to the gate and work our way back.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: That's a lot of ground to cover.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I know, I built it.  I've just never seen it this way.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: You know, on our honeymoon, we should go scuba diving.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let's not talk about that now, okay?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ... If nothing's wrong, why are we stopping here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You sound like Houston Mission Control.  What the hell does it mean?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Swim where?  Out there?  Oh, no, forget it, not me!  You go, I'm staying.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, and so will I be if I start swimming in that blackass jungle.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Okay, stay.  We'll come back for you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What mind?  If I had a mind, I'd never have let you talk me into this.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'd have fallen in love with a pilot or a mountain climber.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, I don't want to leave now. I'm having too good a time... Of course I'm coming!  You'd think you're gonna leave me?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You would, wouldn't you?  I'd end up whale shit, you wouldn't care.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Get your reserve bottle and let's go.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I think so.  I'm not sure... Are you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's all right, baby.  We're safe...

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: How the hell did it get in here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: God, they're horrible.  I hate them.  Did you see its eyes?  How black they are?  The look in them?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Don't think about it.  It's over.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's never over...  Here comes another six years of bad dreams.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I know I can capture it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Kathryn, you're crazy.  Really crazy.  A suicidal maniac.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  Really nice.  Who's your designer?  Sassoon Shark?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I got it on sale.  A real steel.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Should protect you a little, from the compression.  If that thing gets ahold of you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wouldn't this whole thing be a little safer in the daytime?

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's easier to lure sharks at night.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You amaze me.  I'm more scared than you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can use a shot of what he's got.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: After this has opened, when everything's settled down, you and I are going away.  Just the two of us.  No dolphins, no sharks, no whales, no penguins. Just you and me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: We'll go to Palm Springs, Death Valley, Arizona desert, anyplace where there's no water.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Get some sleep.  And tell Sean I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's my new perfume.  Great White, the Man-Eater.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I need more pressure in the shark tank.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I want to make sure the White is getting enough flow.  Would you do that for me?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No,  I'm not going through there.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Michael, come on, don't be silly. This is the quickest way.  You're not going to walk all the way around?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm not going to walk through that shark arcade.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: They're not going to hurt you. They're encased in plastic.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't want to see them, Kathryn.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Michael, I don't have time. Please!  It's time you dealt with this and got over it.  Now come on!

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: Calvin wants me to move the White for tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ... He ought to put him in here.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It's too soon to move him.

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: I did.  He wants it on exhibit.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, that's why you got it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I have to get out of here.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I can't!  My dad had it, and I don't know if you can inherit it or what, but I got it, and I hate it.  I can't stand it!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Put it under your pillow and sleep on it and the tooth fairy will --

turns.speaker: KATHRYN
turns.text: It was removed from Charlie Overman's body.
